meanings.sent1: After a long day of playing, the puppy slumbered in its cozy bed.
meanings.sent2: The baby slumbered peacefully in the crib, breathing softly.
meanings.sent3: The tired cat slumbered on the warm windowsill, dreaming of chasing birds.
meanings.sent4: Night slumbered over the city, wrapping it in a blanket of darkness.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the forest slumbered, with only the rustling leaves breaking the silence.

meanings.definition: To be in a state of rest or sleep
meanings.sent1: The old bear slumbered in its den throughout the winter months.
meanings.sent2: The entire household slumbered peacefully as the rain tapped on the roof.
meanings.sent3: The computer slumbered on the desk, waiting to be awakened by a touch.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to have slumbered in the ancient ruins, frozen in history.
meanings.sent5: The village slumbered under the starlit sky, unaware of the approaching storm.
